message.content: {"id": "23935", "title": "Bug 23935: Text widget with Tree parent does not lose focus", "description": "Both the Text and Tree widgets are children of the shell. Currently, the text widget does not lose focus when clicking anywhere in the tree widget. This issue is observed only on Windows. Possible workaround is to create the text editor as a sibling of the tree and move it above the tree to ensure proper focus behavior.", "OB": "The text widget does not lose focus when clicking anywhere in the tree widget.", "EB": "The text widget should lose focus when clicking anywhere in the tree widget.", "SR": "To fix this issue, the text editor should be created as a sibling of the tree widget and moved above the tree widget to ensure that it loses focus when clicking anywhere in the tree."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>

We can probably work around by creating thetext editor as a sibling of the tree and moving it above the tree. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'When youclick anywhere in the tree the tree gets focus. '}
